name: Sir Henry Parkes
what_did:
Sir Henry Parkes was a leader who helped bring the Australian colonies together.
He gave a famous speech about uniting as one nation.
People call him the 'Father of Federation'.
why_matters:
Parkes helped create the idea of Australia as one country.
He believed people would be stronger if they worked together.
His vision led to the founding of modern Australia.

fun_fact: There’s a whole town named Parkes in New South Wales — after him!
